PGP Encryption
Made Easy

Copy and paste your way
to secure communication.

download

how it works

1

Generate a key pair

This creates a public key and a private key. A public key is what you share with others so people can send you messages, while the private key is what unlocks them.

2

Add keys to your keychain

Your keychain is like your buddy list of contants you can send encrypted messages to. You can find public keys to add to your keychain on sites like...

3

Encrypt a message

Send messages such as your address on darknet markets or any sensitive information intended to be only opened by those you choose from your keychain.

Download

challenge power

Don’t care about your privacy? According to Glenn Greenwald, you’re saying "I have agreed to make myself such [an] uninteresting person that I don't fear having the government know what… I'm doing."

Protecting your communication has never been this easy. Use Felony to encrypt messages, such as your address on darknet markets or any sensitive information intended to be viewed strictly by intended recipients. The NSA can't read your message. Facebook can’t read your message. Not even your mom can read your message. PGP is widely accepted as , now put to use for your personal privacy.

Take control of your online identity, using Felony to sign messages. Using your private key, recipients can verify a message was sent by you and wasn’t altered by a third party.

- The Felony Team

Open Source

Anyone can contribute and anyone can see how it works which makes it much more secure— and completely free of charge.

Secure

Felony is built using OpenPGP.js. Therefore, the core encryption codebase has had a complete security audit conducted by Cure53.

Accessible

Designed by a professional UX designer that’s worked at a startup with 30million in funding, with feedback from people at YCombinator, Uber, and more.

How it works
